verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Call Jehovah thy salvation, rest beneath th'Almighty's shade; in His secret habitation dwell, and never be dismayed.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: There no tumult shall alarm thee, thou shalt dread no hidden snare; guile nor violence can harm thee, in eternal safeguard there.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: From the sword at noonday wasting, from the noisome pestilence, in the depth of midnight blasting, God shall be thy sure defense.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Fear not thou the deadly quiver, when a thousand feel the blow; mercy shall thy soul deliver, though ten thousand be laid low.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Only with thine eyes the anguish of the wicked thou shalt see, when by slow disease they languish, when they perish suddenly.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: Thee though winds and waves be swelling, God, then hope, shall bear through all; plague shall not come nigh thy dwelling, thee no evil shall befall.
